tuv.seg: When you buy goods or services in Ireland or another EU Member State you are protected by consumer legislation
Nuair a cheannaíonn tú earraí nó seirbhísí in Éirinn nó i mBallstát eile an AE tá cosaint agat ó reachtaíocht tomhaltóirí
If your consumer rights are not being honoured you will need to complain and sometimes it can be difficult to know what to do if something goes wrong
Mura bhfuil maith á dhéanamh de do chearta tomhaltóirí beidh ort gearán a dhéanamh agus bíonn sé deacair uaireanta fios a bheith agat cad ba cheart a dhéanamh má théann aon rud in aimhréidh
• Follow the retailer's or service provider's complaints process
• Abair go soiléir an méid atá tú ag iarraidh a rá
You can find examples of complaint template letters on the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission (CCPC) website
• Éist leis an méid atá le rá ag an miondíoltóir chun míthuiscintí a sheachaint
• Know your consumer rights and refer to consumer legislation
• Bíodh a fhios agat cad atá tú ag iarraidh a bhaint amach
• If you have exhausted the complaints process and you are not satified with the outcome contact the CCPC for advice
• At any point during your complaint you can contact the CCPC or a Citizens Information Centre or the Citizens Information Phone Service for advice
• Ná téigh thar fóir- ní bhfaighidh tú an lámh in uachtar i gcónaí
